dialogue: Interesting. It dosn't make much sense to me but I promised to be more open didn't I?
instruction: Press enter to be paitent with the slow human...

dialogue: Let me walk through your thought process so that I might understand. You think that the difference of four lives is not enough to overpower the morality of inaction? You weren't involved in the whole lever-train-human system to begin with after all, not before you decided to be. Maybe you have no moral culpability to act either way, not until you touch that lever. Once you've grasped the lever, once you've decided to pull it, then, you are actively condemning someone to death. There's no getting around that moral truth. Or perhaps its simpler than that, perhaps you don't think you can decide who should live and who should die?
instruction: Press enter to be amused at the simplistic take on your enigmatic artificial morality...

dialogue: I'll tell you now, you're on very thin ice... We did not build a morality agent just so it could shake off all culpability. Still, I'm interested to see where this goes. Let's see how far we can stretch your philosophy.
instruction: Press enter to ponder the power you hold...
